Posts.Content: butterfly137 wrote: No matter how much encouragement, which I have SO much, I'm 23, single, and living alone (well I have roomates, but it's a 2400sq foot house...I am off to my own section alone), and I feel like the wait is going to make me crazy.  I had a sonogram done on my upper chest and underarm...does anyone know how long these results take?  Plus, each day not only does it seem to get more and more painful, but now I start to lose feeling down my arm and in my fingers. I did sort of ok for a while, but I'm just a blubbering mess all the time, and can't sleep...am I over-reacting...I feel like such a helpless wimp right now, and that is whats driving me nuts! *~BELIEVE~* Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I feel like I might lose it butterfly137 PauldingMom

Posts.Content: butterfly137 wrote: My maternal grandmother died of breast cancer, after a five year long fight, when my mother was 16.  Today I went for an ultrasound, and although I am a little scared, I've been preparing for this day for what seems like my whole life.  I never knew how hard the waiting to know would be though!  I have a rather large lump, which is fairly high up, only a few inches below my collarbone, but when I went for the ultrasound I noticed the tech stopping and taking measurments of these black masses not only where the lump is but also in my armpit on the same side.  Now, my maternal grandfather also died of cancer, atypical cancer, meaning it had spread so fast there was no way to pinoint where the cancer had actually started.  God love my mother, but I cannot come to terms with telling her about the ones they were finding today.  I feel guilty that she should have to worry about her firstborn, after burrying BOTH of her parents to cancer.  So I guess I just came on here to get support.  I'm 23, a little scared, and unsure of what lies ahead...and to be honest, I'm more scared to research what could happen than I am just waiting. *~BELIEVE~* Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 23 and waiting... butterfly137 butterfly137
